Jim Parsons was born on August 20, 1947, in Tulsa, Oklahoma. He grew up in a family of modest means, where his parents, a schoolteacher and a carpenter, encouraged his creative pursuits from a young age. Parsons developed a passion for acting while attending Tulsa's Bishop Kelly High School, where he was active in the school's drama club and even won a local award for his portrayal of the title character in a production of "Romeo and Juliet".

After high school, Parsons attended the University of Oklahoma, where he earned a degree in drama and fine arts. He spent several years honing his craft, working in regional theater and taking small roles in film and television productions.

Parsons' big break came when he was cast as the titular character in the 2007 sitcom "The Middle American," a short-lived but critically acclaimed series that explored the lives of a middle-class family in suburban America. His performance earned him a nomination for a Golden Globe Award for Best Actor in a Television Series.

From there, Parsons went on to land the role of a lifetime when he was cast as Sheldon Cooper in the hit CBS sitcom "The Big Bang Theory." The show, which premiered in 2007 and ran for 12 seasons, followed the lives of a group of socially awkward scientists and their neighbor, a waitress and aspiring actress. Parsons' portrayal of the brilliant but eccentric Sheldon earned him widespread critical acclaim and numerous awards, including four Emmy Awards for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series.

In addition to his work on "The Big Bang Theory," Parsons has appeared in a number of films, including "Hidden Figures," "The Muppets," and "A Kid Like Jake." He has also lent his voice to several animated projects, including "The Simpsons" and "The Muppets."

Throughout his career, Parsons has been recognized for his philanthropic work, particularly in the area of LGBTQ+ rights. He has been an outspoken advocate for the Trevor Project, a national organization that provides crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ+ youth.

Parsons currently resides in Los Angeles with his husband, Todd Spiewak, whom he married in 2017.
